name: Build notification announcement
func:
msg.announcement = "We've just won another " + msg.new_medal_icon + " " + msg.new_medal_type + " medal! We now have ðŸ¥‡ " + msg.gold_medals + " gold, ðŸ¥ˆ " + msg.silver_medals + " silver, ðŸ¥‰ " + msg.bronze_medals + " bronze. Total " + msg.total_medals + " medals. " + msg.new_medal_ranking 

return msg;

Build Google Home announcement

Ranking up
func:
msg.new_medal_ranking = "Our ranking has gone up from " + msg.current_medal_ranking + " to " + msg.medal_ranking

return msg;

name: Ranking down
func:
msg.new_medal_ranking = "Our ranking has gone down from " + msg.current_medal_ranking + " to " + msg.medal_ranking

return msg;

name: Ranking stays the same
func:
msg.new_medal_ranking = "Our ranking remains at " + msg.medal_ranking

return msg;

name: Difference
Proper medal update check? (Open for notes)
info:
Sometimes the new medal count jumps
up way too high, so this ignores those.

Only allows medal updates of 1 or 2 medals
each 5 minutes that the medals are checked.

The tally gets reset daily at 4am

URL to check medal tally (open notes)
info:
For the Paralympics, change the "Get medal tally"
node below, change the Command field to update the URL.

From:
curl -H "user-agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/88.0.4324.182 Safari/537.36" https://olympics.com/en/paris-2024/medals

To:
curl -H "user-agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/88.0.4324.182 Safari/537.36" https://olympics.com/en/paris-2024/paralympic-games/medals


Note I am assuming the Paralympics medal tally URL will be:
https://olympics.com/en/paris-2024/paralympic-games/medals

I have a global snooze all notifications across my entire
Home Assistant set up, so that we don't wake up to the
sounds of announcements when we're trying to sleep
